location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.257 of 1852, from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Kemball writes to confirm receipt of Malet's previous despatch (ff 318-23), informing him that he has personally reprimanded the Muscat native agent, Khojeh Hiskael. Kemball attributes Hiskael's actions to inexperience rather than a conscious disregard of authority, and is confident such an incident will not be repeated. Kemball reflects briefly on Hiskael's position in Muscat, noting that his 'character as a Jew and the nature of his duties' may contribute to the antagonism existing between himself and the Imam's representatives.
